On tir, 2005-12-13 at 07:57, callforshadab wrote:
> hi all, 
> After running a one day crawl i got data in the arc file format. now i want 
> to get records from that arc file. But when i am using the arcreader 
> provided with the heritrix "/bin/arcreader" with the command  
> $bin/arcreader -f gzipdump <path to arc file> 
> it's not doing anything, except that, initially it displays some sensible 
> charactor later on it starts displaying non- sensible characters. I also tried 
> some other software for extracting arc file. for eg: ark, etc. etc. 
> But they all show error message "unknown archive format or corrupted 
> archive" 
>  
> And when i type  
> $arc -e IAH-20051212122925-00000-myhost.mydomain.arc 
>  
> it gives the error message 
>  
> An entry in IAH-20051212122925-00000-myhost.mydomain.arc has a 
> bad header. 
> hdrver: 66 
>   37209 bytes skipped. 
>  
> Can anybody tell me what should i do?? :-( 

Without seeing the arc file in question, there is little we can say.

> While Dealing with the arc format some queries came in to my mind.  
> 1. What is the advantage of arc file format?? 

It scales very well and is easy to understand and implement.  It does
not handle changing data, though.

> 3. Can more than one threads read the records from the same arc file at 
> the same time. 

If the reader program is written correctly, yes.  The arc format says
nothing about the readers at all.

> 4. What could be the maximum size of an arc file. 

The ARC format defines no limit, but your filesystem and/or programs
may.  Typically we aim for either 100MB or 500MB to make sure the
filesystem is happy.

> 5. How can i write my own arc reader that reads the various documents 
> from the arc file. 

Read http://www.archive.org/web/researcher/ArcFileFormat.php (note that
version 2 is not used).

> 6. What kind of format does the arc file stores. 

Any, but that doesn't mean that you can understand the contents.

-Lars
